 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נסק‎</span> whence <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶסַּק‎</span> [[Ps.139.8|Ps 139:8]] according to [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] and others; but see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סלק‎</span>. 

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סָלֵק‎</span> **verb** ==ascend== (loan-word from Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎סְלֵיק‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סלק‎</span> ***id.***, [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>329</sup> [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>85</sup>; Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סלק‎</span> Pi\`el ***remove***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ascend***, [[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>1410</sup> (also loan-word ?)); — only **Qal** ***Imperfect*** 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶסַּק‎</span> [[Ps.139.8|Ps 139:8]] ***if I ascend to heaven*** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁמַיִם‎</span> ), thou art there (on form, = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶסְלַק ֗֗֗ ‎</span>, see [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:66e»§ 66e</sup> [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>i. 301</sup> [[BDB#Kau|Kau]]<sup>§ 44</sup>).
